intro: Guettarda coccinea, commonly known as the red guettarda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant floral displays. Guettarda coccinea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
